messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New Member
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Chris - Welcome to the discussion group! To post photos you need to go to photos at the bottom of these emails and post them there, then direct everyone
messages.messageBody:
Hi Chris -

Welcome to the discussion group! To post photos you need to go to "photos" at the bottom of these emails and post them there, then direct everyone to your "file" once you open a file. Any photos sent as attachments will not make it through, as attachements are deleted.

Always interesting to hear how these swords came into the hands of today's caretakers. It sounds as if what your father brought home might be more than just mass produced "weapons," being mounted as you described. Do you know how to remove the handles to look for any maker's signature? I'm sure somebody here will instruct you on a few "care" pointers, etc.

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: cehlers1949
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, May 12, 2008 1:27 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] New Member


I just wanted to say Hi and that I am glad I found this group. My father died not long ago
and left two samurai swords which are now in my possession. He acquired them in Papua
New Guinea after the battle of Buna. One is in a plain brown storage case and the other is in
a pebbled case with a leather cover. I hope, over time, to discover all that I can about them.
As my father never talked about his 4 years of fighting in the Pacific theatre, these are the
only link that my siblings and I have to his time there. We hope that as we learn more about
these swords, we will also learn about those times and the valorous men who fought on both
sides. I won't have expertise to share, but look forward to learning a great deal from all of
you. Is it permissible to post photos on this site?

Chris





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New Member
messages.msgSnippet: Elliot, While at the SF TK, U should take in the Sword Etiquette demo, put on by the JSSUS, Sat. morning, Grey Doffin always makes the sword handling basics
messages.messageBody:
Elliot,
While at the SF TK, U should take in the Sword Etiquette demo, put on by the
JSSUS, Sat. morning, Grey Doffin always makes the sword handling basics
informative for all, (new and old guys!),

Rick
Calgary, AB

> Swords table.

messages.subject: New Member
messages.msgSnippet: I became a member yesterday. I am doing my best to learn all about Nihonto and related subjects. What better group to join than this one. I am going to be at
messages.messageBody:
I became a member yesterday. I am doing my best to learn all about
Nihonto and related subjects. What better group to join than this one.
I am going to be at the SF Token Kai in 2 days. Next week I will
attempt to become involved with you.

If anyone is attending the SF show, please look me up at the Shibui
Swords table.

Later,

Elliott
